name: Gabriel M. Kuper
content: Gabriel Kuper -- Home Page Gabriel Kuper Associate Professor E-mail Address: Department of Information and Communication Technology , Università di Trento Via Sommarive 14, I-38050, Povo, Trento, Italy Phone: +39 0461 882090 I received my B.Sc. degree in Mathematics from the Technion, Israel, and my Ph.D. degree in Computer Science from Stanford University. I was a researcher at the IBM T.J.Watson Research Center from 1985 until 1992, and at  the European Computer-Industry Research Centre (ECRC) in Munich from 1993 to 1996. During 1996, I was a visitor at the Verso Group at INRIA, near Paris, France, and at the Universite libre de Bruxelles in Belgium. I was a MTS at Bell Labs in Murray Hill from 1996 to 2000 My main research interests are in the area of databases, including object-oriented , constraint and deductive databases. My current work is focused on XML databases, including in particular on typing and querying such data, and on Peer-to-Peer database systems (P2P) Publications Teaching Gabriel Kuper kuper@dit.unitn.it
